posts.post_content: @Tsuichoi No, she wasn't. No hints suggested anything of the sort. Sorin is very B/W--the moral reason and balance are one and the same. He used to be human, remember, and he only became a vampire because Edgar decided to make him one on a whim. Avacyn is very holy--why else would she be "Avacyn, Angel of **Hope**"? No one knows exactly how she was created, and there's no reason to insult anyone else's deck. Or their intelligence. Seriously.

Posted By: dlgn (5/8/2012 9:57:31 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Paleopaladin: There's still mass -X/-X effects. My zombie deck, for example, could sac its army (including a [Noxious Ghoul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Noxious Ghoul)) and bring it back with [Balthor the Defiled](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Balthor the Defiled) to give all your creatures -8/-8 or more, killing Avacyn, Sigarda, Melira, Platinum, and Pristine. Late-game, Mutilate works too.  
  
Plus [Upheaval](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Upheaval), [Evacuation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Evacuation), [Inundate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Inundate), and [Wash Out](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wash Out) (White) still screw up your plans. Especially with a Warped Devotion in play.  
  
Also, [Hallowed Burial](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hallowed Burial) and [Final Judgment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Final Judgment).
posts.html:
Paleopaladin: There's still mass -X/-X effects. My zombie deck, for example, could sac its army (including a Noxious Ghoul) and bring it back with Balthor the Defiled to give all your creatures -8/-8 or more, killing Avacyn, Sigarda, Melira, Platinum, and Pristine. Late-game, Mutilate works too.

Plus Upheaval, Evacuation, Inundate, and Wash Out (White) still screw up your plans. Especially with a Warped Devotion in play.

Also, Hallowed Burial and Final Judgment.

posts.post_content:
Do planeswalkers have the power to create souls? I know Karn created a plane, but I thought the creatures were all imported from elsewhere, and Karn was pretty special. Is Avacyn a soulless automaton?  
  
@MaDaZi: yes, creatures with zero toughness are always put in the graveyard ("dies"), even if they haven't been dealt combat damage that turn. They aren't "destroyed". The germ tokens in Living Weapons and small creatures after a Curse of Death's Hold resolves die the same way.
posts.html:
Do planeswalkers have the power to create souls? I know Karn created a plane, but I thought the creatures were all imported from elsewhere, and Karn was pretty special. Is Avacyn a soulless automaton?

@MaDaZi: yes, creatures with zero toughness are always put in the graveyard ("dies"), even if they haven't been dealt combat damage that turn. They aren't "destroyed". The germ tokens in Living Weapons and small creatures after a Curse of Death's Hold resolves die the same way.

Posted By: stompfest (5/20/2012 3:01:26 AM)

posts.post_content:
I'm very curious as to rather or not she knows she was created by Sorin or not. If not, then I wonder if she wonders... If she does know... then I wonder how she feels about it. Is she just loyal to Sorin, does she despise him but grudgingly respect him? Does she care?   
  
She may look boring on the surface, but she's actually quite an interesting question once you think about her... And I think this is what Wizards were shooting for... as quiet and Aloof as she seems to be.  
Side note: if you really zoom in on her eyes, she does have pupils, their white and look like a full moon.  
(Check the official art, not the card.)
posts.html:

She may look boring on the surface, but she's actually quite an interesting question once you think about her... And I think this is what Wizards were shooting for... as quiet and Aloof as she seems to be.
Side note: if you really zoom in on her eyes, she does have pupils, their white and look like a full moon.

Posted By: Zoltantf (5/15/2012 1:04:28 AM)

posts.post_content:
@ Doragon  
  
I wasn't trying to be self-entitled. I meant it as an example to what she fits better. She keeps balance in that she is on the side of the humans. She evens it out not as an impartial middle but as a stronger fighter for one side. She does keep balance, but doesn't kill the humans should they start murdering all the vampires. There are even flavor texts that say the vampires were pushed even farther down in power with her return. Also, as to saying that she is not a preaching angel, she is the figurehead and power behind a whole church. There are those that worship her and she supports the people that seek her out. She doesn't just stand there with no interaction from anyone who follows her looking down on them as "naive" humans. She fights for them actively and bolsters them.   
  
How could Sorin's creation of her not be noble? He chose subsistence over decadence and chose to protect humanity. He could've watched them all die and he wanted to prevent that from happening. Even ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
